summary: U.S. Secretary of State Marco Rubio has warned foreign nationals that visas can be revoked if they engage in activities deemed harmful to American national interests. Rubio made the comments during a joint press conference in Budapest with Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orbán. The warning comes amid heightened scrutiny of foreign nationals participating in political activism and media activity in the United States. Rubio's remarks were seen as a signal of a more aggressive enforcement posture toward visa compliance and national security screening. The comments were made during a high-profile visit to Hungary, where Rubio praised Orbán's leadership and highlighted the close personal relationship between the nationalist leader and President Donald Trump. Rubio also signed an agreement on U.S.-Hungarian civilian nuclear cooperation, aiming to strengthen Central Europe's energy independence.
